Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, exterior covered with a brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded, containing a list of "Bundles".
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.125)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87637) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87637)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 148 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
